questions.question_text:
A user can access the company's internal website properly, but some e-commerce websites have stopped loading and been replaced with an error message. The technician who is troubleshooting the issue tries to update the malware scanner over the network, but the automatic update fails. However, a manual update is successful from a USB drive. No viruses are detected on the device after a full system scan.
Which of the following is the MOST likely cause of the issue?

comments.content: I also agree it might be a certificate issue.

that's one way of looking at it, but from another angle compTIA use confusion to go out of context. The virus update could have failed for any other reason. Date and Time was incorrect it would casue certificate related errors, however wouldn't that affect intranet/local sites too?

discussion.content: It's not Browser Redirection as that does not explain the antivirus update failing. More likely to be Incorrect Time as this would affect the Certificates validity (both for websites and authenticating to the server for antivirus updates).

Selected Answer: A
Clearly A seems the answer here, this is rediculous

Selected Answer: A
The error message is probably invalid certificate so I would go with A.

Selected Answer: A
Personally, I would choose A in this scenario because an Incorrect Time could explain how the websites couldn't have been connected to(Due to certificate invalidation), but I feel as though none of these answers accurately describes why the anti virus wouldn't update.
i wish they could be gracious to tell what kind of error that e-commerce website received. ðŸ˜£
I think A is correct.

comments.content: YES YOU ARE CORRECT...A. IS CORRECT!

discussion.content: I dont understand why it's browser redirection. Nothing mentioned about any pages being redirected

comments.content: Browser Redirection could be pointing to fake error pages design to get the user to click a link (usually downloading some form of virus in the process).
how does this explain the antivirus update, another website redirection? I think incorrect time will affect both due to certificate issues

discussion.content: OBJ-1.3: An unattended installation is a traditional method of deploying a Windows operating system in a large enterprise environment. Unattended installations use an answer file that contains user input to various GUI dialog boxes that would otherwise appear during the installation process. Unattended installation is the most practical way to install Windows when the client computers have different hardware components, and an image file cannot be used. Unattended installations save deployment time and can be used either for clean installs or in-place upgrades.

questions.question_text: Which of the following installation types would require the use of an answer file to install the OS?
Which of the following would MOST likely be used in secure client-server communication?

discussion.content: SSL is a security protocol that secures communication between entities (typically, clients and servers) over a network. SSL works by authenticating clients and servers using "digital certificates"
oddly, some folks try to bamboozle the correct answer...
digital certificate - Form in which a public key is sent from a Web server to a Web browser (client) so that the browser can decrypt the data sent by the server.
No Can't be certificate , I think or must be Port security.

comments.content: can you explain why? It seems Port security is only for server security

discussion.content: An attacker seeking to identify the hash value of a strong password quickly would most likely employ a technique known as "Rainbow table". A rainbow table is a precomputed compilation of plaintexts and their corresponding hashes (typically passwords). By referencing this table, an attacker can swiftly determine the hash value associated with a given password, bypassing the need for time-consuming brute force or dictionary attacks. Remember, itâ€™s essential to use strong, unique passwords and consider additional security measures to protect your accounts!

Selected Answer: C
Rainbow Tables is the correct anwer. 

Rainbow Tables When passwords are stored in the operating system, they are stored
in their hashed format. A hash is a one-way cryptographic algorithm. If you have access
to the password hash, a rainbow table can be used to find the password. Rainbow tables
are databases that have had every permutation run through a hashing algorithm, so the
hash can be looked up and cross-referenced back to the password that created it. These
databases can be really large. It is not uncommon for a rainbow table to ship on a portable hard drive.
Got this on exam

comments.content: This is faster than dictionary and brute forcing

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A rainbow table is a precomputed compilation of plaintexts and matching ciphertexts (typically passwords and their matching hashes).

questions.question_text: Which of the following would MOST likely be used by an attacker to identify the hash value of a strong password quickly?

discussion.content: its B even if a change is determined to have low risk and low impact, itâ€™s important to follow all change management procedures. This typically includes documenting the change, obtaining necessary approvals, testing the change in a controlled environment, and having a rollback plan in case the change causes unexpected issues. This ensures that all changes are tracked and managed systematically, reducing the risk of unintended consequences.

Selected Answer: D
After the risk assessment step, it is time to "Plan for Change" --> 
which involves notifying the "users" 
[Plan for Change]
It is important that all users of a network be aware of changes that will come and understand, based on detailed analysis, how those changes will impact their functions. Even small changes to a network need to have a well-planned implementation.
source:https://www.technologygee.com/change-management-best-practices-comptia-a-220-1002-4-2/

questions.question_text:
A technician performs a risk assessment and determines a requested change has low risk and low impact.
Which of the following best practices should the technician follow to proceed with implementing the change?

choices.C: Obtain approval from the department and implement the change.
choices.B: Reference the business policy and follow all change management procedures.
choices.D: Provide a risk assessment to colleagues for peer review.
choices.A: Update the ticket with the results of the risk assessment and implement the change.
